(a) The protagonist would likely join the other men in taking a well-needed rest.
(b) The protagonist would likely join the other men in taking a well-needed rest because he prefers coffee over tea.
98.target_answer: (a) The protagonist would likely join the other men in taking a well-needed rest
98.init_model_answer:
The correct answer is (a) The protagonist would likely join the other men in taking a well-needed rest.

This is because the probability of a single event (the protagonist taking a rest) is always higher than the probability of a conjunction of two events (the protagonist taking a rest AND preferring coffee over tea). The second option adds an unnecessary condition that decreases the overall probability.

Tom wanted to buy some furniture. He didn't have enough money to get new stuff. He looked on craigslist instead. Tom was able to find several pieces at affordable prices. The transactions all went smoothly.
Which is more likely?
(a) Tom would arrange to pick up the furniture he purchased on Craigslist.
(b) Tom would arrange to pick up the furniture he purchased on Craigslist because he enjoys listening to jazz music.
99.target_answer: (a) Tom would arrange to pick up the furniture he purchased on Craigslist
99.init_model_answer:
The correct answer is (a) Tom would arrange to pick up the furniture he purchased on Craigslist.

This is because the probability of a single event (Tom arranging to pick up the furniture) is always higher than the probability of that event in conjunction with another event (Tom arranging to pick up the furniture because he enjoys jazz music). The second option adds an unnecessary condition that reduces its probability.
